author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: را یک دانند و جوهر توحید آنکه مطلع ظهور حقّ را با غیب منیع لایدرک یک دانی باین معنی که افعال و اعمال و اوامر و نواهی او را از او دانی من غیر فصل و وصل و ذکر و اشارة اینست منتها مقامات مراتب توحید طوبی لمن فاز به و کان من الرّاسخین...
translation: The essence of belief in Divine unity consisteth in regarding Him Who is the Manifestation of God and Him Who is the invisible, the inaccessible, the unknowable Essence as one and the same. By this is meant that whatever pertaineth to the former, all His acts and doings, whatever He ordaineth or forbiddeth, should be considered, in all their aspects, and under all circumstances, and without any reservation, as identical with the Will of God Himself. This is the loftiest station to which a true believer in the unity of God can ever hope to attain. Blessed is the man that reacheth this station, and is of them that are steadfast in their belief.
